newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-ANZ says to cut 356 jobs.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-ANZ says to cut 356 jobs.

text.p: Australia and New Zealand Banking Group Ltd said on Tuesday it would cut a net 356 jobs from May 26 because of plans to streamline lending processes.
ANZ said the job cuts would lead to unspecified cost savings.
The cuts were part of changes to divide the bank's retail customers into small business and consumer banking.
ANZ chief general manager Australian retail division, Peter Hawkins, said the moves were aimed at creating more efficient and focused service.
The bank had already begun a campaign to assist small business, and started to expand its National Finance Centre in Melbourne to offer more centralised support, he said.
Hawkins said the changes would mean 120 new positions in teams which would focus on gaining new business.
After taking into account these new jobs, an overall reduction of 356 positions was expected.
However, ANZ said the changes, due to be implemented in metropolitan areas excluding Tasmania on May 26, would separately create up to 155 new positions in the National Finance Centre.
